stance_1: I am mindful of nutrition after a health scare
stance_2: I include meat in at least one meal a day
justification: Being mindful of nutrition after a health scare motivates the interviewee to include meat regularly for its nutrients.

stance_1: I am mindful of nutrition after a health scare
stance_2: I try to eat less over-processed frozen dinners
justification: The interviewee explicitly connects their health scare and mindfulness with eating less over-processed food.

stance_1: I am mindful of nutrition after a health scare
stance_2: I want to get nutrients from meat
justification: The interviewee's health scare and focus on nutrition are explicitly tied to wanting nutrients from meat.

stance_1: I am mindful of nutrition after a health scare
stance_2: I try plant-based products for variety
justification: Becoming more mindful about nutrition after a health scare implicitly supports experimenting with plant-based products for variety and health.

stance_1: I feel healthier after eating plant-based products
stance_2: I try plant-based products for variety
justification: The interviewee explicitly states trying plant-based products for variety and feeling healthier after eating them.

stance_1: I include meat in at least one meal a day
stance_2: I want to get nutrients from meat
justification: The interviewee explicitly connects including meat daily with wanting to get nutrients from meat.

stance_1: I try plant-based products for variety
stance_2: I want to get nutrients from meat
justification: Trying plant-based products for variety may conflict with a singular focus on getting nutrients from meat, as plant-based products are partially replacing meat.
